item.title: Google Currency Converter - How to change number of decimal places for the converted currency?
item.description:
This is in response to asscore's question - How to change number of places after the decimal for the Google Currency Converter module.

By default, Google returns the converted currency in 4 decimal places. To change to 2 decimal places, all we need to do is to grab the value of the converted currency and use the standard PHP number_format() function to format it to 2 decimal places.
item.author: kksou@kksou.com (kksou)

item.title: Google Directions with Multiple Stopovers
item.description:
The following sample shows how to display Google Maps directions for multiple destinations or stopovers using the googleDirections plugin that uses the latest Google Maps API v3.

Important: This plugin makes use of the googleMaps plugin and googleDirections plugin to display the map. So please make sure you have installed googleMaps plugin v1.0.17/1.5.17/1.6.17/1.7.17 (or above) and googleDirections plugin v1.0.11/1.5.11/1.6.11/1.7.11 (or above) for this plugin to work.

If you have downloaded and installed the above plugins before the Christmas of 2011 (i.e. Dec 25, 2011), you are using the old version. Please update the two plugins to the latest version.
item.author: kksou@kksou.com (kksou)

item.title: googleDirections - To Here - plugin Tutorial 01: Getting Started
item.description:
This is part 1 of a series of tutorial for the googleDirections - To Here - plugin.

Using the googleDirections plugin is as easy as 1-2-3:

  1. Specify your Home Address - i.e. the end point, or where you want your customer to go to. This can be real address or in latitude/longitude.

  2. Specify the width, height and dir_width. This sets the size of your map (width and height), and also the width of the directions (dir_width).
item.author: kksou@kksou.com (kksou)

item.title: googleDirections - To Here - plugin Tutorial 02: Adding Label to Home Address
item.description:
This is part 2 of a series of tutorial for the googleDirections - To Here - plugin.

You can add a label to the Home Address with the keyword home_label. The label will be displayed when you hover the mouse over the red marker, or when you click on the red marker.

Note:

  • The label with the red marker will only be shown when the map is displayed initially with nothing entered in the "Coming From" field.

  • The moment the directions are displayed, the red marker will be replaced by the end point (usually Point B which corresponds to the directions given in the Directions Panel)

  • You can re-display the original map with the red marker by entering an empty field (i.e. clearing the "Coming From" field) and click the submit button.
item.author: kksou@kksou.com (kksou)

item.title: googleDirections - To Here - plugin Tutorial 03: Travel Modes
item.description:
This is part 3 of a series of tutorial for the googleDirections - To Here - plugin.

When displaying Google directions, you need to specify which transportation mode to use. The following travel modes are currently supported by Google:

  • DRIVING indicates standard driving directions using the road network.
  • WALKING requests walking directions via pedestrian paths & sidewalks (where available).
  • BICYCLING
    • requests bicycling directions via bicycle paths & preferred streets (currently only available in the US).

If you do not specify any travel mode, the default used is DRIVING.
item.author: kksou@kksou.com (kksou)

item.title: googleDirections - To Here - plugin Tutorial 04: Unit Systems - miles or km
item.description:
This is part 4 of a series of tutorial for the googleDirections - To Here - plugin.

  1. By default, directions are calculated and displayed using the unit system of the origin's country or region.

  2. For example, a route from "Chicago, IL" to "Toronto, ONT" will display results in miles, while the reverse route will display results in kilometers.

  3. Origins expressed using latitude/longitude coordinates rather than addresses always default to metric units.

  4. You can specify the unit system to be used in the driving instructions:
    • METRIC specifies usage of the metric system. Distances are shown using kilometers.
    • IMPERIAL specifies usage of the Imperial (English) system. Distances are shown using miles.
item.author: kksou@kksou.com (kksou)

item.title: googleDirections - To Here - plugin Tutorial 05: Display Directions on the Left
item.description:
This is part 5 of a series of tutorial for the googleDirections - To Here - plugin.

  1. By default, the Google Map is displayed on the left and the routing directions on the right.

  2. If you prefer to display the map on the right and the directions on the left, you can use the keyword map_on_right=1
item.author: kksou@kksou.com (kksou)

item.title: googleDirections - To Here - plugin Tutorial 06: Display Directions below the Map
item.description:
This is part 6 of a series of tutorial for the googleDirections - To Here - plugin.

  1. By default, the Google Map is displayed on the left and the routing directions on the right.

  2. If you prefer to display the directions below the map, you can use the keyword vertical=1
item.author: kksou@kksou.com (kksou)
